_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FIELD SOLUTIONS LLC  IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT PRIMARILY  SELLS AND CUSTOM APPLIES,  FERTILIZER TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS FOR CROP ENHANCEMENT.

THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT CONSIST OF ONE 30,000 AND THREE 11,000 GALLON TANKS WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 281,000 POUNDS. IN ADDITION THERE ARE 24-1000 GALLON NURSE TANKS WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 105,000 POUNDS (4400 POUNDS PER TANK), FOR AN AGGREGATE OF 386,600 POUNDS OF STORAGE AT ANY ONE TIME.  THE PLANT IS DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED WITH STRICT ADHERANCE TO ALL LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR FACILITIES EACH YEAR AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENT.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD RELEASE A TOTAL OF 132,000 POUNDS WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF 1.1 MILES AND HAS THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT APPROXIMATELY 1000 AREA RESIDENTS.

THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED ON A REGULAR BASIS IN THE SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND THE MAINTENANCE PRACTICES OF A TYPICAL AMMONIA PLANT.  THEY ALWAYS USE GOGGLES AND THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS.  CLEAN SAFEY WATER IS ALWAYS PRESENT DURING THE AMMONIA OPERATION.

THIS COMPANY, BECAUSE OF ITS TRAINING PROGRAM CAN BOAST OF NO INJURY ACCIDENTS AND OR ANY PROPERTY DAMAGE WITHIN THE LAST FIVE YEARS.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED AND DISCUSSED WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THEY'VE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL TOXIC RELEASE OR ANY OTHER EMERGENCY SITUATION WHICH MAY EXIST.  TOURS ARE GIVEN TO LOCAL FIREMAN TO MAKE THEM AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.
